item.title: Game Engine in C++ with OpenGL
item.description:
Description

ModelOne is a 3D game engine developed in 1 year for Windows, written in C++ using the OOP paradigm and various supporting libraries. With this engine, it can create not only games but also interactive applications. At the moment there are no plans to add more major features, only bug fixes, due to the development of a new engine made in Vulkan (https://gomezjuanjose.github.io/post/cenginevulkan/).

Features

  • Layered architecture
  • ECS
  • Renderer with OpenGL
  • GLSL support
  • OBJ loader
  • Basic physics system
  • Event system
  • Logger and assertions
  • Dear ImGui support
  • Audio
  • Profiler

Soon it’s expected to make available a PDF that explains everything.

Download

https://github.com/GomezJuanJose/ModelOne

item.title: Game Engine in C with Vulkan
item.description:
Description

This is a 3D game engine made in C with Vulkan (with plans to support DirectX and OpenGL) from scratch. The project started in September 2024, after finishing a first iteration of ModelOne, because of the passion and the willingness to learn about game engine development. At the moment this engine is in a very early stage.

Features

Download
